extension.dc:title: Plinian Core Extension
extension.name: Plinian Core Flat version 2.3
extension.dc:description: The Plinian Core is a set of concepts that defines the necessary basic attributes to integrate and recover the information about species of organisms required by users specialized in biodiversity as well as users of other areas. This extension is supposed to be used in addition to the taxon core and the simple images, vernacular names and references extension.

property.name: creator
property.dc:description: Person or main entity responsible for creating the entry. For example, include a person, an organization and the contact information. Usually this description includes the name of the creator of the entry and his/her organization.

property.name: contributor
property.dc:description: Source for Dublin-Core standard element “Contributors”: General contributors, editors, translators and others. In the fact sheet must be separated by semicolon.

property.name: created
property.dc:description: Date/time when the intellectual content (project, term, description, etc.) was first created. Please use dc:modified in the core for the date last modified!

property.name: distribution
property.dc:description: Comment about the distribution of the species based on information from the collection sites of the studied specimens.

property.name: abstract
property.dc:description: General description of the taxon. This concept could point out any information about the taxon. Its main goal is summarize the most relevant or attractive characteristics of this taxon to the general public.

property.name: typification
property.dc:description: Citation of type material according to TCS

property.name: habit
property.dc:description: It refers to the life form associated to its environment, particularly for plants; for example, grass, tree, bush, epiphyte, etc.

property.name: lifeCycle
property.dc:description: Life history of a living organism: The course of developmental changes in an organism from fertilized zygote to maturity or stages through which an organism passes.

property.name: reproduction
property.dc:description: Data about reproduction of the species in wildlife or in captivity.

property.name: annualCycle
property.dc:description: Recurrent biological phenomena correlated with climatic conditions, as bird migration or plant flowering.

property.name: scientificDescription
property.dc:description: Description to distinguish the species from other close or similar ones.

property.name: briefDescription
property.dc:description: Brief description, presented in a simple technical language, to distinguish the species from other close or similar ones.

property.name: feeding
property.dc:description: Information related to supply food for the development and sustenance of the individual and/or its offspring.

property.name: behavior
property.dc:description: Responses, reactions or movements made by an organism in a particular situation.

property.name: interactions
property.dc:description: Mutual or reciprocal actions or influences. For example, predation, parasitism, mutualism, etc. Relations with products grown and stored by man (plagues) are also included.

property.name: chromosomicNumberN
property.dc:description: Chromosomic Number

property.name: molecularData
property.dc:description: Information about molecular taxonomy obtained from the author or the literature.

property.name: populationBiology
property.dc:description: Information about the number of individuals per area or time unit.

property.name: threatStatus
property.dc:description: Conservation status.

property.name: legislation
property.dc:description: A national or regional proposed law or group of laws.

property.name: habitat
property.dc:description: General description of the sites where the species is found (ecosystem, forest, environment or microhabitat).

property.name: territory
property.dc:description: Information associated mostly to vertebrates, referring to the territorial extension of the individual or group in terms of its activities (feeding, mating, etc.)

property.name: establishmentMeans
property.dc:description: Maps to plinian core "endemicity". Endemism describes species that are native to a particular geographic area or continent. Endemism usually occurs in areas that are isolated in some way.

property.name: theUses
property.dc:description: Known or potential uses of the species, at a direct economic level, as instruments of education, prospecting, eco-tourism, etc. It includes published material or suggestions from the author or others. In any event, the source must be explicitly quoted.

property.name: theManagement
property.dc:description: Breeding and cultivation Control.

property.name: folklore
property.dc:description: Known myths or legends that people or literature contribute about the species.

property.name: unstructuredDocumentation
property.dc:description: Unstructured Documentation

property.name: identificationKeys
property.dc:description: Keys to identify infraranks.

property.name: migratoryData
property.dc:description: Migratory data

property.name: ecologicalSignificance
property.dc:description: Ecological significance

property.name: unstructuredNaturalHistory
property.dc:description: Unstructured natural history

property.name: invasivenessData
property.dc:description: Invasiveness data

property.name: audience
property.dc:description: Maps to plinian targetAudiences. Users to which the information is addressed. The defined audiences are: Biodiversity researchers, teachers and students, decision makers, professionals from another areas and general public
property.examples: Biodiversity researchers, teachers and students, decision makers

property.name: version
property.dc:description: Information of the current version.
